name: CONTROLEUR FINANCIER
description:
• Le contrôleur Financier encadre des équipes chargées des activités suivantes : comptabilité, trésorerie, fiscalité, contrôle de gestion, audit, juridique, communication, systèmes informatiques, etc.

Gestion  Administrative :
  • Définir les principaux processus et les systèmes de contrôle interne appropriés
  • Mettre en place les procédures de gestion et les indicateurs nécessaires au suivi des activités et au reporting à la direction.
  • Veiller au respect des procédures et des délais
  • Veiller à la bonne application des procédures de qualité et d'amélioration continue 
  • Veiller au respect des normes ISO, le cas échéant
 
Comptabilité, contrôle de gestion et rapports :
  • Veiller à la fiabilité et à la conformité des états comptables et financiers. 
  • Préparer les documents financiers et comptables dans le respect de la législation et des délais.
  • Préparer les rapports financiers mensuels, trimestriels et annuels
  • Respecter les normes comptables françaises
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le contrôleur financier et contribuer à la préparation des analyses et des rapports, etc.
  • Établir le budget et le plan d'affaires de l'entreprise en fonction des choix stratégiques de l'actionnaire et de la direction générale.
Trésorerie, crédit, recouvrement, relations bancaires :
  • Préparer les plans de financement de l'entreprise et approuver les budgets de trésorerie pour répondre aux besoins de financement externe.
  • Suivre la situation de trésorerie et analyser les écarts par rapport aux prévisions. 
  • Communiquer les besoins de trésorerie au département financier du groupe.
  • Préparer des prévisions de trésorerie pour différentes périodes
  • Respecter et appliquer les procédures de gestion des dépenses et des paiements (approbation des finances, des commandes, des factures et des paiements conformément aux directives du groupe).
  • Contrôler les besoins en fonds de roulement.
Gestion juridique
  • Assurer l'approbation des comptes annuels en liaison avec les juristes.
  • Soutenir les équipes opérationnelles dans les litiges avec les partenaires/fournisseurs et coordonner avec les avocats.
  • Contrôler la signature des accords de confidentialité et des contrats avec le service des achats.
Gestion des systèmes d'information opérationnels
  • Identifier et développer des outils informatiques en fonction des besoins de l'entreprise et de l'équipe : outils de groupe, ERP en collaboration avec le responsable des systèmes d'information opérationnels.
  • Comptabilité 
  • Finance 
  • Juridique 
  • Compétences en matière de gestion d'équipe et de leadership
  • Outils bureautiques, bonne maîtrise d'Excel requise
  • Outils comptables (SAGE, OpenProd)
  • Anglais courant exigé
Un diplôme de niveau Bac+5 en finance est requis, ainsi qu'une solide expérience dans un poste de gestion financière.- Un salaire et des avantages compétitifs.
- L'opportunité de travailler dans un environnement dynamique et en constante évolution.
- Possibilités de développement professionnel et de croissance.
- Défis professionnels, tâches stimulantes et diversifiées 
- Environnement multiculturel 
- Horaires de travail flexibles et jours de télétravail 
- Atmosphère étendue, boissons chaudes et fruits à disposition

name: Contrôleur de gestion
description:
• Budgétisation et prévision :
    • Diriger le processus de budgétisation, y compris les prévisions, l'analyse des écarts et la consolidation du budget.
    • Développeur des modèles financiers pour soutenir la planification d'entreprise, les initiatives stratégiques et la prise de décision.
    • Surveiller et contrôler les dépenses d'exploitation, en mettant en œuvre les initiatives de réduction des coûts si nécessaire. 
  • Modélisation et analyse financières :
    • Créer et maintenir des modèles financiers complexes pour soutenir la planification stratégique, les prévisions, les stratégies de tarification et les décisions d'investissement.
    • Analyser les principaux moteurs de l'activité, les tendances du secteur et les performances des concurrents afin de fournir des informations et des recommandations à la direction générale.
    • Collaborer avec des équipes interfonctionnelles afin d'élaborer des modèles pour le lancement de nouveaux produits, les stratégies de tarification et l'expansion des marchés.
  •  Conformité et gestion des risques : 
    • Veiller au respect de la législation fiscale locale, des exigences statutaires et des politiques internes.
    • Identifier les risques financiers et mettre en œuvre des stratégies d'atténuation des risques.
  • Amélioration des systèmes et des processus : 
    • Mener des initiatives visant à améliorer les systèmes, les outils et les processus financiers pour une meilleure efficacité et une plus grande précision. 
    • Piloter les efforts d'automatisation et de transformation numérique au sein du département financier.
Formation et expérience :
  • Licence ou master en finance, comptabilité, contrôle de gestion, économie ou dans un domaine connexe.
  • Minimum de 3 ans d'expérience en gestion financière ou dans un rôle similaire, de préférence dans un environnement international.
  • Expérience confirmée des principes comptables français.
 
Compétences :
  • Solides compétences en matière d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes.
  • Maîtrise des logiciels financiers (par exemple, Sage, Microsoft Dynamics) et compétences avancées en Excel.
  • Excellentes aptitudes à la communication et aux relations interpersonnelles ; maîtrise du français et de l'anglais. 
  • Capacité à gérer des priorités multiples et à travailler dans des délais serrés.
  • Haut niveau d'intégrité et normes éthiques.
  • Souci du détail et esprit stratégique.
- Un salaire et des avantages compétitifs.
- L'opportunité de travailler dans un environnement dynamique et en constante évolution.
- Possibilités de développement professionnel et de croissance.
- Défis professionnels, tâches stimulantes et diversifiées 
- Environnement multiculturel 
- Horaires de travail flexibles et jours de télétravail 
- Atmosphère étendue, boissons chaudes et fruits à disposition

name: Finance Manager for CEE
description:
Are you an experienced Finance Manager and like working as a core member of an international team? 

You will represent the financial perspective in the Software Development Team in Budapest and the entire CEE Team and be the reliable contact person of the CEE Region to the Group Finance Team in Hamburg, Germany, as well as work closely with regional payroll providers, accountants and HR manager for CEE.

Main responsibilities:
  • Preparation, analysing and submission of Financial Reporting Package to the Head of Group Consolidation.
  • Manage and control daily accounting operations (purchasing, sales, banking, taxes, stocks, development management).
  • Control Capex, OPEX and Treasury.
  • Preparation of Forecasts.
  • Supervise Payroll.
  • Close cooperation with HR.
  • Invoicing including intercompany billing.
  • Document management defined by law.
  • Support in the yearly budgeting process.
  • Review and preparation of statutory financial statements, supervise the monthly accounting/ monthly tax declaration and year-end accounting/ annual financial statement.
  • Being the reliable contact person for the external auditor and tax authorities.
  • Being the internal financial business partner in international projects (financial analysis of projects in CEE countries).
  • Observe the security and methodological stipulations of her/his Employer.
Job requirements, experience needed:
  • Relevant college or university degree, charted accountant qualification and registration.
  • Minimum a 5-year professional experience in a similar position, from which at least 3-year work-experience in an international corporate environment (matrix organization).
  • Knowledge of Accounting and Tax legislation (local GAAP, IFRS).
  • Familiarity with Transfer Price Policy.
  • Experience in monthly reporting, cash-flow, intercompany cost transfers, liaising with tax advisors.
  • Practice in Financial Controlling and BI Analysis.
  • Very Strong MS Office skills, especially Excel.
  • Good command of business English, both in speaking and writing.
  • Efficient communication with Hungarian and Foreign colleagues with business and/or technical background.
  • Independent problem-solving skills.
  • Reliable and precise work.
  • Professional college or university degree

We are offering
  • professional challenges, inspiring, diverse tasks
  • multiculture environment
  • flexible working hours and home office days
  • relaxed atmosphere, steady, supportive international team
  • easily accessible modern office with good infrastructure
  • complimentary coffee, fruits and snacks

name: Finanzcontroller/Projektcontroller (m/w/d)
description:
Your diverse tasks can be assigned to the following three main areas:

Project Controlling:
  • You constantly monitor commercial project costs, manage project team meetings and continuously review and optimize project reporting.
  • You create plan/actual comparisons, carry out variance analyses and monitor costs.
  • As a sparring partner for the project management team, you support projects and implement ad hoc analyses.

Financial Modeling and Analysis:
  • You will create and maintain complex financial models to support strategic planning, forecasting, pricing strategies and investment decisions.
  • You will be responsible for analyzing key business drivers, industry trends and competitor performance to provide insights and recommendations to senior management.
  • You will enjoy working in cross-functional teams as well as developing models for new product launches, pricing strategies and market expansions.

Budgeting and Forecasting:
  • You will lead the budgeting process, including forecasting, variance analysis and budget consolidation.
  • You will be responsible for developing financial models to support business planning, strategic initiatives and decision making.
  • Monitor and control operating expenses and implement cost saving initiatives.

  • You have successfully completed your Bachelor's or Master's degree in finance, accounting, controlling, economics or a related field.
  • You have at least 3-5 years of experience in financial management or a similar function, preferably in an international environment.
  • You have already proven your strong analytical and problem-solving skills many times.
  • You have knowledge of BI software, ERP systems and advanced Excel skills.
  • Your excellent communication skills are convincing, as are your very good German and English skills.
  • You are confident and proven in self-management, work detail-oriented and think strategically.
Modern, centrally located office: Just a 5-minute walk from Bahrenfeld station - easy access guaranteed!

Open corporate culture: Immerse yourself in an international working environment where ideas and diversity are encouraged.

Collegial working atmosphere: Enjoy a working atmosphere characterized by collaboration and a hands-on mentality

Hybrid working model: Flexibility - combine on-site and home office work.

30 days holiday: More time for relaxation and leisure. Additional days off on 24 December, 31 December and half a day on your birthday.

Attractive remuneration package: We reward your performance appropriately.

Sodexo vouchers: For carefree catering while you work.

HVV season ticket or underground car park subsidy: Support for your convenient journey.

JobRad: Take advantage of the opportunity to lease a JobRad after your probationary period.

Company pension scheme: With a generous 25% employer contribution of up to €75.

name: Head of Software Development
description:
Are you an experienced Head of Development and like working as a senior leader of an international team? 
 
At Telio you will lead the company’s technology development efforts, with a primary focus on driving innovation, optimizing performance, and leading the software development team. The role is key in ensuring the company’s technological capabilities support its strategic objectives in a competitive landscape. You will be responsible for managing end-to-end software delivery, ensuring scalability, security, and reliability, while fostering a culture of continuous improvement and technological excellence. Your target is to build and maintain successful and sustainable products, which are in line with the Telio strategy.


  • Product Development:
    1. Oversee the entire development lifecycle, from idea to delivery and maintenance of services, applications, websites, mobile apps, and digital products.
    2. Lead the development of innovative solutions that enhance customer experiences, improve operational performance, and support emerging technologies.
    3. Coordinate with product team to design and implement features/solutions that meet customer needs and drives profit/revenue.
  • Leadership and Strategy:
    1. Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing development team, including software engineers and QA professionals.
    2. Collaborate with the C-level to align development goals with the company’s strategic objectives.
    3. Develop and implement the technology roadmap to support current and future business needs
    4. Ensure agile methodologies and development best practices are effectively implemented across the team.
  • Team Management:
    1. Build, inspire, and retain a diverse and talented development team.
    2. Foster a collaborative environment that encourages knowledge sharing, innovation, and continuous improvement.
    3. Conduct performance evaluations, set objectives, and create development plans to support team growth and skill enhancement.
    4. Boost the cooperation of R&D teams with the other teams (Product, IT, DevOps and PMO)
  • Technology and Innovation:
    1. Keep up with industry trends and new technologies on the market, ensuring the company remains competitive and innovative.
    2. Identify opportunities for adopting new technologies that improve efficiency, scalability, and reliability.
    3. Drive initiatives around automation, microservices, and hybrid cloud development, ensuring the company leverages modern software architecture principles.
    4. Manage the knowledge and intellectual property of the company: architecture, design, source code, documentation, automation, configuration management, know-how.
  • Collaboration and Stakeholder Management:
    1. Partner with cross-functional teams including IT operations, product management, and sales to deliver integrated solutions that meet market demands.
    2. Cooperate with third-party vendors and technology partners to ensure seamless integration of external solutions.
    3. Engage with key stakeholders to prioritize development projects and allocate resources effectively.
  • Operational Excellence:
    1. Ensure all development initiatives meet performance, security, and scalability standards. Pay special attention on the information security aspects of the development process and the final products.
    2. Drive continuous improvement by optimizing the development process, minimizing downtime, and ensuring quick response to issues.
    3. Lead post-launch troubleshooting and maintenance activities, ensuring uptime and service quality standards are met.
    4. Monitor, report, and improve key performance metrics such as time-to-market, code quality, and system reliability.
  • Budgeting and Resource Management:
    1. Manage the development budget, ensuring cost-effective delivery of projects/products without compromising quality.
    2. Oversee resource allocation and project prioritization to ensure on-time, on-budget delivery of high-quality technology solutions.
  • Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
  • 10+ years of experience in software development, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
  • Proven experience in an online/telecommunications and digital environment, including understanding of products, services, and network infrastructure.
  • Strong expertise in software architecture, cloud technologies, microservices, APIs, and DevOps.
  • High level knowledge of Microsoft and Java technologies.
  • Deep understanding of SDLC methodologies such as Agile, Scrum, and DevOps practices.
  • Proven ability to lead and scale development teams, manage large-scale projects, and drive high-impact initiatives.
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and tools.
  • Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to navigate complex organizational challenges and influence without authority.
  • Excellent English proficiency.
  • Be part of an innovative market leader company
  • Lead a high-impact team working on cutting-edge technology.
  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Opportunities for growth and advancement in a dynamic, fast-paced industry.
  • Flexible working hours and home office days
  • Easily accessible modern office with good infrastructure
  • Complimentary coffee, fruit and snacks

  • Experience with Grafana

  • Technical documentation skills

name: Senior Software Test Engineer
description:
Are you an experienced software tester, ready to take the next step in your career?

You like exciting projects and working as a core member of an international team?

Are you interested in the telecommunications industry?

As a member of our team you will participate in manual and automated testing, validating, specifying and documenting of the IT and telecommunication systems produced and operated by our company. You will take an active part in test planning, test case development. You will work close with other team members: software developers, product owners, IT professionals and external partners.

Major responsibilities and tasks


  • Managing the design, implementation and execution of functional and non functional tests.
  • Support Integration and Regression testing.
  • Maintain test environments and participate in CI/CD related activities.
  • Executing the manual & automated tests in the short term, and automate the manual tests in the medium term.
  • Analyzing test results on database impacts, errors or bugs, and usability.
  • Preparing test documentation.
  • Validating specifications and setup guides.
  • Taking active part in test planning, test case development. 
  • Working closely with other team members: architects, product owners, software developers, IT and external partners.

Required qualifications and skills

  • at least 3+ year experience as a software tester
  • experience in non-functional testing (Performance, Security)
  • strong experience in troubleshooting 
  • strong knowledge and experience in automated testing (not only UI Automation but API as well)
  • strong analytical, engineering, and technology skills that include practical application, techniques, and principles
  • knowledge of test methods 
  • high level expertise in using test management software
  • independent problem-solving skills and product focused way of thinking 
  • good command of English

Required:

  • Microsoft technologies (Windows infrastructure, IIS)
  • Database basics (SQL/MSSQL)
  • API Testing Tool (e.g.: Postman, SoapUI)

 

Advantage:

  • BSc, MSc or higher level in Computer Science
  • Programming basics (C#/.NET)
  • Atlassian JIRA/Confluence
  • Robotframework
  • Linux knowledge
  • VOIP
  • ISTQB certification (any level)
  • Non-Functional Testing tool (e.g.: JMeter)
  • Experience in mobile application testing

 


We are offering

  • professional challenges, inspiring, diverse tasks
  • structured development process
  • learning path on new technologies (AI, LLM)
  • multiculture environment
  • flexible working hours and home office days
  • relaxed atmosphere, steady, supportive international team
  • easily accessible modern office with good infrastructure
  • complimentary coffee, fruit and snacks

name: Service Center Expert (m/f/d)
keywords: Field Service,Customer Service, First Level Support,Customer
description:
Do you like to have an impact on customer experience? Are you the ‘spider in the web’ who connects services and processes with clients? Is the answer yes and yes? Then this opportunity is for you.
 
As a service center expert you will be part of the international service center of Telio Group. Based in our beautiful Amsterdam offices, in a relaxed atmosphere you will work closely with other colleagues from the service team, the Country Manager Netherlands and the rest of the supportive international Telio team.

What does that mean exactly?
  
  • Our face to the customer: you will answer requests and questions by e-mail, telephone and our Service portal and advise our users on appropriate actions
  • Problem solver: you will solve minor technical issues or escalate them to our second level Technical Services and IT  
  • Validate, classify, prioritize: continuous incident communication till the resolution  
  • Everything on track: you keep the service level agreement (SLA) and achieve a high first contact resolution (FCR). You create, develop and communicate reports, such as root cause analysis and follow standard service center procedures, and keep track of tickets in JIRA  
  • Our expert: you will get a comprehensive understanding of our products and enhance the Service Center knowledge base  
  • New ideas welcome: you identify operational and service improvements to further improve our customer experience
  • There for our customers: shift work during weekdays, on-call duty for off-hours and weekends, willingness to do client site visits from time to time
  • Professional, emphatic and fun person to work with!  
  • Extensive service center experience, ideally in the field of telecommunication and/or IT
  • Excellent communication skills (spoken and written)  
  • Fluent Dutch and English is a must (upper intermediate B2)  
  • Good task management & work organization, ability to work independently
  • Confident mastery of Microsoft Office products, working with Jira (or another ticketing system is an advance)
  • Living in or not too far from Amsterdam. Partly working from home is possible   
We offer you a stable yet very diverse working environment with an outstanding team spirit and atmosphere.
If you love working in a very diverse and technical environment, at a great location in Amsterdam, within an awesome international team, this is the job for you!
 
Next to these amazing perks we offer:
  • An attractive salary package: we honour your performance appropriately
  • Enough time to relax: 26+ vacation days
  • A high level of autonomy
  • It will never get boring: professional challenges, exciting, diverse tasks
  • Opportunity to grow: continuous professional development and training with career growth opportunities
  • Office + home work: mix between working in our beautiful Amsterdam office + home office days
  • The greatest colleagues: relaxed atmosphere, steady, supportive international team
Interested in joining our team? If so, we look forward to receiving your application.

name: Technicien de Tests en Electronique H/F
description:
Le technicien de tests en électronique H/F met en place les scénarios et moyens de tests, analyse et restitue les résultats sur les éléments techniques et fonctionnels à tester. Ses activités principales sont:
  • Mise en place de scénarios et moyens de tests (ex. : bancs de tests)
  • Réalisation de tests et d'analyses pour identifier les écarts de performance des produits : renseigner les supports de suivi d'intervention et rédige les procès-verbaux (essais, contrôles…) et mis à jour des reporting de NC et de KPI (indicateurs de représentations).
  • Débogage de 1er niveau
  • Rédaction du rapport des écarts et dysfonctionnements constatés au cours des tests réalisés
  • Analyse des écarts et causalités identifiées
  • Diagnostiquer les dysfonctionnements, orienter les produits défectueux vers les services concernés, analyser les défaillances
  • Fait remonter les points bloqués
  • Contrôler le fonctionnement et veille au respect des normes des équipements électroniques
  • Organisation des tests systématiques ou aléatoires, en sortie de chaîne de production
  • Contrôle final de la production d'un point de vue produit et documentaire
Connaissances professionnelles spécifiques:
  • Établit et réaliser des programmes / procédures de test à partir du cahier des charges et des dossiers techniques
  • Sélectionne le matériel de contrôle ou d'essais et vérifier sa conformité
  • Renseignez les supports de suivi d'intervention et rédige les procès-verbaux (essais, contrôles…)
  • Contrôler le fonctionnement et veille au respect des normes des équipements électroniques
  • Diagnostiquer les dysfonctionnements, orienter les produits défectueux vers les services concernés
  • Assure la remise en condition et le suivi du bon fonctionnement du matériel ou du système en défaut
  • Fait preuve de flexibilité en aidant à la production en cas de surcharge de travail
  • Maîtrise des logiciels de Conception de Fabrication Assistée par Ordinateur (CFAO)
  • Respecter les normes de qualité
Ce poste est accessible avec un bac +2 en électrotechnique ou électronique.Ce que nous offrons :
- Un salaire et des avantages compétitifs.
- L'opportunité de travailler dans un environnement dynamique et en constante évolution.
- Possibilités de développement professionnel et de croissance.
- défis professionnels, tâches stimulantes et diversifiées
- environnement multiculturel
- atmosphère étendue, boissons chaudes et fruits à disposition
